name: Use the corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO instead of plain END statement (RPG400)
description: This rule searches all the artifacts using plain END statements instead of corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO etc.
output:
This report lists RPG400 artefact using plain END statement, instead of corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO, etc.
It provides the following information:
RPG400 artifact full name
rationale: Using corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO increases readability of the code and therefore maintainability.
remediation: Try to replace the plain END with the corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO etc.
alternativeName: Use the corresponding END statement such as ENDIF, ENDDO instead of plain END statement (RPG400)
